questions.question: What is the empirical formula of MOF-177 as synthesized in the study?
questions.answer: The empirical formula of MOF-177 as synthesized in the study is ZnO4(BTB)2·(DEF)3·(H2O)9.

questions.question: What role does the nitrogen atom play in the structure of Y2@C79N?
questions.answer: In Y2@C79N, the nitrogen atom substitutes for one of the C80 carbon atoms, introducing one unpaired electron spin.

questions.question: How does the encapsulation of Y2@C79N in MOF-177 affect its electron spin resonance (ESR) characteristics at low temperatures?
questions.answer: The encapsulation of Y2@C79N in MOF-177 leads to axisymmetric hyperfine splitting in the ESR spectra at or below 213 K, indicating an orientational state of Y2@C79N molecules inside the pores of MOF-177.

questions.question: True or False: The synthesis of MOF-177 involves heating zinc nitrate with H3BTB in N,N-diethylformamide (DEF).
What is the significance of the Curie constant value change in Y2@C79N⊂MOF-177 below 260 K as observed in SQUID measurements?
questions.answer: The change in Curie constant value below 260 K for Y2@C79N⊂MOF-177 suggests a transition in the dynamical states of Y2@C79N molecules, possibly due to different orientations within the cavity of MOF-177.

questions.question: True or False: The paramagnetic properties of Y2@C79N⊂MOF-177 single crystals are dependent on the Y2@C79N loading amount.
What experimental technique was used to confirm the presence of yttrium in the Y2@C79N⊂MOF-177 complex?
questions.answer: X-ray photoelectron spectroscopy (XPS) was used to confirm the presence of yttrium in the Y2@C79N⊂MOF-177 complex.

questions.question: How does the orientation of Y2@C79N molecules change in MOF-177 at low temperatures according to ESR analysis?
questions.answer: At low temperatures, the orientation of Y2@C79N molecules in MOF-177 changes to exhibit axisymmetric hyperfine splitting, indicating a more ordered arrangement.

questions.question: True or False: The study demonstrates that MOF-177 can accommodate Y2@C79N molecules through π–π interactions.
What potential applications are suggested for the Y2@C79N⊂MOF-177 solid spin system?
questions.answer: The Y2@C79N⊂MOF-177 solid spin system is suggested for use in quantum computation, nanoscale nuclear magnetic resonance detection, and probing the motion of biomolecules.
